alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 12 at 7:33PM CDT until October 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds sustained at 30 to 45 mph with gusts as high as 55 to 65 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock and Red Willow Counties. * WHEN...Until 12 PM MDT /1 PM CDT/ Friday. The strongest winds are expected to occur Friday morning, mainly between 3-10 AM MDT, 4-11 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. High winds will also create hazardous travel conditions, particularly for high profile vehicles on west to east routes such as Interstate 70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reductions in visibility associated with blowing dust are possible Friday morning, mainly between sunrise and noon.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
